answer:
The BC Centre for Disease Control (BCCDC) does not have immunization coverage data for specific schools.  However, your local public health unit may have this information. You can find the contact information for your local public health unit here. 
The BCCDC does however have immunization coverage data at the provincial/health authority/health service delivery area level for children at their second birthday and school-aged children. You can find the BCCDC immunization coverage reports here. 
- Immunization Nurse
answer_formatted:
## The BC Centre for Disease Control (BCCDC) does not have immunization coverage data for specific schools.

However, your local public health unit may have this information.
You can find the contact information for your local public health unit here.

## The BCCDC does however have immunization coverage data at the provincial/health authority/health service delivery area level for children at their second birthday and school-aged children.

You can find the BCCDC immunization coverage reports here.
- Immunization Nurse
question: If I have an immunocompromised, but healthy, child in school how do I find out if other children have up to date vaccination schedules in order to protect my child to the best of my ability?
question_variation_0: when do i know if vaccine schedules are up to date?
question_variation_1: how to find out if children have up to date vaccine schedules?
question_variation_2: do all school children need vaccinations
